GSD.description: There is a denial of service vulnerability in the Content-Disposition parsingcomponent of Rack fixed in 2.0.9.2, 2.1.4.2, 2.2.4.1, 3.0.0.1. This could allow an attacker to craft an input that can cause Content-Disposition header parsing in Rackto take an unexpected amount of time, possibly resulting in a denial ofservice attack vector. This header is used typically used in multipartparsing. Any applications that parse multipart posts using Rack (virtuallyall Rails applications) are impacted.

osvSchema.details:
There is a denial of service vulnerability in the Content-Disposition parsing
component of Rack. This vulnerability has been assigned the CVE identifier
CVE-2022-44571.

Versions Affected: >= 2.0.0
Not affected: None.
Fixed Versions: 2.0.9.2, 2.1.4.2, 2.2.6.1, 3.0.4.1

# Impact

Carefully crafted input can cause Content-Disposition header parsing in Rack
to take an unexpected amount of time, possibly resulting in a denial of
service attack vector. This header is used typically used in multipart
parsing. Any applications that parse multipart posts using Rack (virtually
all Rails applications) are impacted.

# Workarounds

There are no feasible workarounds for this issue.
